full_text: PALM BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT Incident Report Date: 9/01/06 Time: 13:38:06 Page: 9 Program: CMS301L 1-03-001498 (Continued) A Palm Beach County property search revealed that one Alessi owns the property at 1515 South Flagler Dr., Apt. 1901, and has resided there since 2001. Invest. Cont. ************************* NARRATIVE #5 ************************* GREENE Reported By: GUDGER, ELMER C. 10/15/03 Entered By: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/15/03 On Monday, 10/13/03, at 2:00 p.m., Mr. Jeffrey Epstein came into the police department and informed me that earlier today he met with his former houseman Juan Alessi at Green's Pharmacy in Palm Beach. Epstein stated that he presented Alessi with a photograph obtained off the video surveillance system, whereby Alessi admitted to breaking into the house and taking the money. Alessi told Epstein that he broke into the house to take a gun that Epstein usually keeps behind his desk. He could not find the gun so he took the money. Alessi said he and his wife are having problems and they no longer live together. He wanted the gun because he was contemplating suicide. Epstein stated that Alessi has already returned $2,000. of the stolen money and that he will be making arrangements with Alessi to pay off the remaining funds. I asked Epstein if he knew of Alessi's current address or phone number and Epstein said that Alessi was going to call him at 5:00 p.m. today and he would make arrangements for Alessi to come into the police station to be interviewed. Epstein stated he no longer wants to prosecute Alessi but is concerned over the fact that the gun Alessi said he broke into the house to steal is still missing, yet Alessi said he does not have it. ATTN POLICE CLERKS: As Alessi has returned $2,000. to Epstein and arrangements have been made for the return of the rest of the money, please show a full recovery of the $2700. cash. ************************* NARRATIVE #6 ************************* GREENE Reported By: PAGAN, MICHELE D. 10/15/03 Entered By: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/15/03 On Monday, 10/13/03, Det. Dawson and I responded to 1515 South Flagler Drive where we met with Mrs. Mary Alessi. Mrs. Alessi stated she does not know her husbands current address and provided us with a cell phone for him. While speaking to Mrs. Alessi, Det. Dawson made telephone contact with Juan Alessi and made arrangements to meet with him back at the Palm Beach Police Department. According to Mrs. Alessi, the last time she saw her husband Juan F. Alessi, DOB 02/12/50, was today, 10/13/03. on Okeechobee Blvd. when she saw her husband drive by. She stated she received a telephone call from him on her cell phone Page 53 of 111 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 07/26/17 DOJ-OGR-00031463

text_blocks.content: PALM BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT Incident Report
1-03-001498 (Continued) A Palm Beach County property search revealed that one Alessi owns the property at 1515 South Flagler Dr., Apt. 1901, and has resided there since 2001. Invest. Cont.
************************* NARRATIVE #5 ************************* GREENE Reported By: GUDGER, ELMER C. 10/15/03 Entered By: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/15/03

On Monday, 10/13/03, at 2:00 p.m., Mr. Jeffrey Epstein came into the police department and informed me that earlier today he met with his former houseman Juan Alessi at Green's Pharmacy in Palm Beach. Epstein stated that he presented Alessi with a photograph obtained off the video surveillance system, whereby Alessi admitted to breaking into the house and taking the money. Alessi told Epstein that he broke into the house to take a gun that Epstein usually keeps behind his desk. He could not find the gun so he took the money. Alessi said he and his wife are having problems and they no longer live together. He wanted the gun because he was contemplating suicide. Epstein stated that Alessi has already returned $2,000. of the stolen money and that he will be making arrangements with Alessi to pay off the remaining funds. I asked Epstein if he knew of Alessi's current address or phone number and Epstein said that Alessi was going to call him at 5:00 p.m. today and he would make arrangements for Alessi to come into the police station to be interviewed. Epstein stated he no longer wants to prosecute Alessi but is concerned over the fact that the gun Alessi said he broke into the house to steal is still missing, yet Alessi said he does not have it.
ATTN POLICE CLERKS: As Alessi has returned $2,000. to Epstein and arrangements have been made for the return of the rest of the money, please show a full recovery of the $2700. cash.
************************* NARRATIVE #6 ************************* GREENE Reported By: PAGAN, MICHELE D. 10/15/03 Entered By: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/15/03

On Monday, 10/13/03, Det. Dawson and I responded to 1515 South Flagler Drive where we met with Mrs. Mary Alessi. Mrs. Alessi stated she does not know her husbands current address and provided us with a cell phone for him. While speaking to Mrs. Alessi, Det. Dawson made telephone contact with Juan Alessi and made arrangements to meet with him back at the Palm Beach Police Department. According to Mrs. Alessi, the last time she saw her husband Juan F. Alessi, DOB 02/12/50, was today, 10/13/03. on Okeechobee Blvd. when she saw her husband drive by. She stated she received a telephone call from him on her cell phone

additional_notes: The document appears to be a police incident report with two narratives. The report is typed and contains no handwritten text or stamps. The document is related to a burglary incident involving Jeffrey Epstein's house and his former houseman Juan Alessi.
